span.br: Charles City Community Schools update: bit.ly/3aTjG1s

span.span: Under the advisement of the Iowa Department of Public Health and local medical professionals, Charles City Community Schools will be extending spring break beginning March 16, 2020 through March 23, 2020. This effort is being taken in order to mitigate community spread of COVID-19. Additionally, all events, extracurricular activities, athletic practices, competitions, parent-teacher conferences, and performances are suspended during the extended break.

Although there are no cases of COVID-19 in Floyd County as of Sunday night, medical professionals are encouraging using an abundance of caution. In addition, the Iowa Department of Public Health suggests canceling activities of more than 250 people. Each of our schools is a community of at least this size.

This extended break also allows families who traveled over spring break to show symptoms of COVID-19 and allows them the opportunity to self-isolate. If you are sick it is absolutely critical that you stay home.

We anticipate resuming school on Tuesday, March 24. In the unlikely scenario we are closed longer we will have a long-term food plan in place so students who count on the school to provide two meals a day will have access to extra resources. Also if needed, we will roll-out a childcare plan for healthcare professionals and essential emergency personnel whose work is critical to continue their defense against COVID-19.

We recognize the significant impact this extended closure will have on our entire community, and we take this action with the safety of the community foremost in mind. We will keep you informed as to how this will alter the school calendar as we learn more from the state legislature and the Governor. The good news is we still have several cushion days built into the school calendar that weren’t used for snow days.

Our continuing pledge is to share updates with you as quickly as possible and with full transparency. We will continue to stay in close conversation with state and local officials, and we will keep you informed as we learn more.
You can ask questions at https://forms.gle/RAgzU8PthTco88TV9 and we will answer them individually or we will include them in future FAQs.
